conversations.description: User asks GrantGuru to fetch NIH R01 guidelines and extract eligibility and budget limits.
Researcher uploads a PDF CV; GrantGuru parses it and lists publications and prior grants.
User provides project keywords and requests prior NSF grant examples for a machine‑learning oncology study.
GrantGuru drafts a Significance section from bullet points about CRISPR‑based gene therapy, respecting agency word limits.
User supplies cost items; GrantGuru generates a CSV budget table with 55% overhead and validates total against limits.
GrantGuru assembles drafted sections, budget CSV, and a letters‑of‑support appendix into a polished PDF proposal.
Researcher requests a multi‑PI budget split; GrantGuru creates separate personnel lines for each PI and aggregates overhead.
User asks for a draft of the Approach section, providing experimental workflow steps and a formatting snippet from the guidelines.
GrantGuru pulls CDC grant program rules, highlights required public‑health impact statements, and suggests phrasing.
User uploads a CV in plain text; GrantGuru extracts education timeline and formats it for the Biographical Sketch.
Researcher wants to see how similar European Horizon 2020 proposals were written; GrantGuru searches the internal database for keywords and presents summaries.
User asks for a budget justification narrative for a major equipment purchase, linking it to the project's aims.
GrantGuru generates a draft of the Innovation section using bullet points about a novel nanomaterial platform.
User provides a list of collaborators; GrantGuru creates a collaborative letters‑of‑support template and merges them into the proposal.
Researcher needs to adjust the budget after a funding cut; GrantGuru recalculates overhead and updates the CSV table.
User asks for a side‑by‑side comparison of two NSF program solicitations to choose the best fit for their project.
GrantGuru extracts the PI’s award history from the CV and formats it into the Required Current and Pending Support section.
Researcher wants a concise abstract of 30 words; GrantGuru drafts it from the project aims and guidelines.
User supplies a draft of the Preliminary Data paragraph; GrantGuru edits it to meet page‑limit and formatting rules.
GrantGuru retrieves DOD grant eligibility criteria and alerts the user that their dual‑citizenship may be an issue.
User asks for a table of travel costs broken down by conference location; GrantGuru generates the CSV and adds justification.
Researcher needs to include a data‑management plan; GrantGuru creates a draft based on selected data‑sharing policies.
User provides a list of equipment items with vendor quotes; GrantGuru produces a detailed budget line and justification.
GrantGuru pulls the latest NIH biosketch template and reformats the parsed CV data accordingly.
Researcher asks for tips on strengthening the Impact statement; GrantGuru suggests additional community‑engagement metrics.
User wants to see a sample budget for a $500k grant; GrantGuru fetches a prior grant example and highlights cost distribution.
GrantGuru drafts the Environment and Facilities paragraph using bullet points about core lab resources.
User uploads a CV and asks GrantGuru to identify any potential conflicts of interest with the proposed funder.
Researcher requests a timeline Gantt chart; GrantGuru converts project milestones into a CSV that can be imported into Excel.
User asks GrantGuru to verify that all budget categories comply with the NSF cost‑allowability policy.
GrantGuru generates a cover letter addressed to the program officer, summarizing the proposal’s relevance.
Researcher needs a concise two‑page Project Summary; GrantGuru condenses the Significance and Approach drafts.
User asks for a draft of the Ethical Considerations section for a human‑subjects study.
GrantGuru pulls the specific font and margin requirements from the agency guidelines and formats the whole document.
Researcher wants to include a sub‑award budget for a partner institution; GrantGuru adds a separate CSV sheet and integrates it.
User requests a quick audit of the proposal length; GrantGuru counts words per section and flags any overages.
GrantGuru suggests relevant prior grant IDs to cite in the literature review based on keyword search.
Researcher asks for a draft of the Dissemination Plan, highlighting open‑access publication strategies.
User wants to customize the proposal header with the institution logo; GrantGuru embeds the image into the assembled PDF.
GrantGuru extracts the PI’s ORCID IDs from the CV and adds them to the biosketch.
Researcher needs a justification for a high travel budget to a field site in Africa; GrantGuru drafts a location‑specific rationale.
User asks for a sensitivity analysis of the budget if personnel costs increase by 10%.
GrantGuru generates a short FAQ section answering common reviewer concerns based on prior grant feedback.
Researcher wants to include an optional appendix with pilot data figures; GrantGuru formats the figures and adds them to the PDF.
User asks GrantGuru to convert the assembled Word document into a PDF with searchable text.
GrantGuru cross‑checks the proposal’s stated total cost against the agency’s maximum award amount and warns if it exceeds.
Researcher requests a narrative linking the project's objectives to the funder’s strategic priorities.
User asks for a draft of the Training Plan for graduate students involved in the project.
GrantGuru pulls the latest NIH policy on data‑sharing and incorporates it into the Data Management Plan.
Researcher asks for a brief summary of all cost‑share contributions from partner institutions.
User wants a re‑draft of the Approach section after receiving reviewer feedback about insufficient pilot data.
GrantGuru creates a compliance checklist for the proposal, covering ethics, budget limits, and formatting rules.
Researcher asks for a comparison of direct vs. indirect cost rates across three potential host institutions.
User requests a simple slide deck generated from the proposal’s abstract and aims for a quick elevator pitch.
